body:
Need insight on collisions.  If an Observer is frequently colliding, users will need to know.

May also want to track info about load transactions not run by Workers.

issue.title: Create Fluo developer tool
issue.body:
While the monitoring tool (see #20) is geared for admins to track the health of a Fluo cluster, a tool is needed for developers to help them debug observers.  While they have separate use cases, the developer & monitoring tool could be merged into one.  

Below are some possible features for Fluo developer tool:
1. Have worker store last 50 log messages (any level) and last 50 error messages for observers and have tool retrieve them.
2. Retrieve statistics for individual observers.

rename.to: Collect Fluo metrics and expose them to monitoring tools

body: Rather than developing a custom monitoring tool for Fluo, it would be nicer to collect metrics in Fluo using the [dropwizard metrics library](https://dropwizard.github.io/metrics/3.1.0/).  This library allows metrics to be reported to Graphite, Ganglia, or JMX.  Reporting would only occur if configured by user in `fluo.properties`.  Instructions could be provided to help users set up and configure these monitoring tools for Fluo.

issue.title: Move away from using dropwizard to configure metrics reporting
issue.body:
In #20 Fluo started using dropwizard code to parse a yml config file for metrics.  This dropwizard code introduces a lot of dependencies.  Also it make its hard for code running outside the framework to report metrics.   For example its very cumbersome to configure a map reduce or spark job running load transactions to report metrics.  

I think it would be simpler if the metrics config were in the fluo config.  The drawback of this is duplicating the nice config code that dropwizard already has.
